page.title: 01GROSMONT 1 LOCATION
page.content: Grosmont is located on a hill which is why the the Normans called it{Grosmont which means{Big Hill.}They placed the castle on the hill because it has a magnificent view over the{Graig}and {Garway Hills}and the{River Monnow {valley}.It is central to{Ross, {Hereford,Abergavenny}and{Monmouth. The majority of visitors come to the village by car,some by bus or bicycle and a few on foot.Most of the roads around Grosmont are narrow and winding but it is a popular touring area because it is so near to historical sites like{Hereford Cathedral}and {Abergavenny,Skenfrith}and{White {Castles.}Very few visitors come into the village by public transport, because the service is so poor with only two buses a week.These provide a local service to Abergavenny and Hereford on market days.
